benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods - Add a payment method

covered: Valid Payload: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC08, TC10, TC11, TC24, TC25) cover successful creation with various payloads and parameters.
Invalid Payload: TC12 (malformed JSON), TC13 (missing required fields), TC19 (SQL injection), TC20 (XSS) cover input validation and malformed data.
Duplicate Submission: TC21 addresses network failure and duplicate creation prevention.
Large Payloads: TC10 tests handling of maximum allowed field sizes.
Validation: TC14 (invalid accountId format), TC16 (missing required header), TC19, TC20 cover input validation.
Server Error Handling: TC18 (plugin service unavailable), TC27 (plugin returns inconsistent data) cover server error scenarios.
Query Parameters: TC02, TC03, TC04, TC08, TC09 cover various query parameter combinations including unexpected parameters.
Concurrency Issues: TC23 tests concurrent requests handling.
Performance: TC28 and TC29 cover response times under normal and peak load.
Integration: TC26 covers downstream system sync.
Regression and backward compatibility: TC24 and TC25.
Accessibility: TC30 covers API documentation accessibility and error message clarity.
gaps: Duplicate Submission: While TC21 covers network failure and duplicate prevention, explicit tests for repeated identical POST requests to check idempotency or duplicate handling are not clearly defined.
Rate Limiting: No tests cover how the system handles multiple rapid requests or rate limiting.
Soft Deletes or Deletion Behavior: Not applicable for POST but no mention of cleanup or rollback scenarios.
Caching Behavior: No tests cover caching headers or behavior, though less relevant for POST.
Pagination: Not applicable for this POST endpoint but no tests for related GET endpoints if any.
recommendations: Add explicit tests for duplicate POST submissions to verify idempotency or duplicate resource handling.
Include rate limiting tests to ensure the system gracefully handles rapid repeated requests.
Though less relevant for POST, consider verifying any caching headers or behavior if applicable.
Ensure related GET endpoints have pagination and caching tests if part of the same feature set.
